name: 'Man' Made Movies Trivia Quiz | Something in the Title | 10 Questions

questions.text: This film is based on the Sloan Wilson novel about a Madison Avenue executive struggling to get ahead, and to find meaning in his home life. What is it called?
questions.correct: The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
questions.explanation:
The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit.

	Gregory Peck, Jennifer Jones and Fredric March starred in this classic 1956 film.

questions.text: 'The Man with Two Brains' was a 1983 comedy that starred Steve Martin and Kathleen Turner. In it, Martin falls in love with a brain in a jar. What actress lends her voice to the brain?
questions.explanation:
Sissy Spacek.

	Carl Reiner directed and Steve Martin played brilliant surgeon Michael Hfuhruhurr.

questions.text: This musical was based on Cervantes' 'Don Quixote'. Released in 1972, Peter O'Toole and Sophia Loren starred in it. Can you name the film?
options: The Man in the Iron Mask
questions.explanation:
Man of La Mancha.

	This Arthur Hiller film got less than favorable reviews. A disappointing version indeed.

questions.text: 'Man of a Thousand Faces', the biographical movie about silent film star Lon Chaney, starred what Hollywood great?
questions.explanation:
James Cagney.

	The 1957 film about Chaney's life and career was recreated with taste but not accuracy.

questions.text: Jim Carrey starred as Andy Kaufman in this 1999 Milos Forman film. What is its title?
questions.explanation:
Man on the Moon.

	The writers of 'Ed Wood' and 'The People Vs. Larry Flynt' reteamed for this one.

questions.text: Alfred Hitchcock made two versions of this 'man' movie, one in 1934 and one in 1956. What were they titled?
questions.correct: The Man Who Knew Too Much
options: The Man Who Came to Dinner
The Man Who Could Cheat Death
questions.explanation:
The Man Who Knew Too Much.

	Leslie Banks and Edna Best starred in his earlier British version, and James Stewart and Doris Day starred in the later Hollywood version. Day's 'Que Sera, Sera', which appeared in the film, won the Best Song Oscar.

questions.text: The 1955 film, 'The Man With the Golden Arm' starred Frank Sinatra and Eleanor Parker. Who directed?
questions.explanation:
Otto Preminger.

	Sinatra plays a junkie and Parker his crippled wife in this film (at the time, very daring) about drug addiction.

questions.text: Another 'golden' film, 'The Man With the Golden Gun', starred this actor as James Bond. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Roger Moore.

	It was Moore's second shot as the super agent, and was released in 1974.

questions.text: James Stewart stars as a lawyer who helps civilize the West, but needs he man John Wayne to do so. What film is it?
questions.correct: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
questions.explanation:
The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance.

	Regarded as an American classic, John Ford directed the 1962 movie.

questions.text: 'The Man Who Would Be King', a film about two British soldier pals that try to bamboozle high priests of remote Kafiristan into turning over their riches, stars these two actors. Who are they?
questions.explanation:
Sean Connery and Michael Caine.

	This Rudyard Kipling story was directed in 1975 by John Huston.
